1.text: And the Lord went on, and said to Job :

2.text: Shall he that contendeth with God be so easily silenced? surely he that reproveth God, ought to answer him.

3.text: Then Job answered the Lord, and said :

5.text: One thing I have spoken, which I wish I had not said : and another, to which I will add no more.

6.text: And the Lord answering Job out of the whirlwind, said :

7.text: Gird up thy loins like a man : I will ask thee, and do thou tell me.

8.text: Wilt thou make void my judgment : and condemn me, that thou mayst be justified?

9.text: And hast thou an arm like God, and canst thou thunder with a voice like him?

10.text: Clothe thyself with beauty, and set thyself up on high and be glorious, and put on goodly garments.

11.text: Scatter the proud in thy indignation, and behold every arrogant man, and humble him.

12.text: Look on all that are proud, and confound them, and crush the wicked in their place.

13.text: Hide them in the dust together, and plunge their faces into the pit.

14.text: Then I will confess that thy right hand is able to save thee.

15.text: Behold behemoth whom I made with thee, he eateth grass like an ox.

16.text: His strength is in his loins, and his force in the navel of his belly.

17.text: He setteth up his tail like a cedar, the sinews of his testicles are wrapped together.

18.text: His bones are like pipes of brass, his gristle like plates of iron.

19.text: He is the beginning of the ways of God, who made him, he will apply his sword.

20.text: To him the mountains bring forth grass : there all the beasts of the field shall play.

21.text: He sleepeth under the shadow, in the covert of the reed, and in moist places.

22.text: The shades cover his shadow, the willows of the brook shall compass him about.

23.text: Behold, he will drink up a river, and not wonder : and he trusteth that the Jordan may run into his mouth.

24.text: In his eyes as with a hook he shall take him, and bore through his nostrils with stakes.
